net.codemusic.smartears
Interface ISoundEngine

All Known Implementing Classes:
MidiSoundEngine
public interface ISoundEngine

This interface provides the service of actually playing sounds

Method Summary
 void close()
          Call this method when you are done with a ISoundEngine object.
 javax.sound.midi.Instrument[] getInstruments()
          Returns an array of the instruments that this engine is capable of emulating
 void play(IAnswer answer, int base)
          Plays the supplied IAnswer at the supplied base note
 void setDelay(int newDelay)
          Determines the amount of time between the beginning of each note in an IAnswer
 void setDuration(int newDuration)
          Sets the amount of time in abstract ticks that each note sounds
 void setInstrument(javax.sound.midi.Instrument newInstrument)
          Changes the instrument sound the engine uses
 

Method Detail

play

public void play(IAnswer answer,
                 int base)
Plays the supplied IAnswer at the supplied base note

Parameters:
answer - the answer to play
base - the bottom note of the answer

close

public void close()
Call this method when you are done with a ISoundEngine object. It releases any resources that the sound engine may be using. Calling any methods after calling close() will generate an IllegalStateException

setDelay

public void setDelay(int newDelay)
Determines the amount of time between the beginning of each note in an IAnswer

setDuration

public void setDuration(int newDuration)
Sets the amount of time in abstract ticks that each note sounds

getInstruments

public javax.sound.midi.Instrument[] getInstruments()
Returns an array of the instruments that this engine is capable of emulating

setInstrument

public void setInstrument(javax.sound.midi.Instrument newInstrument)
Changes the instrument sound the engine uses

Parameters:
newInstrument - the sound to emulate
